write our name, poem or anything We can write strings by enclosing it in double quotes We have learned this so far In today's video, I will tell you some more things about strings And I will show you what are the other ways to make strings So let's go to the computer screen without wasting time Let's get started Intro So I have come here in my computer screen And now we are going to do something We will open the raplet here quickly So first of all, I open my raplets And go to my 0 to Eru Python course And open our today's raplet So before that, I would like to tell you one thing Many people case you want to join me on Instagram You guys join and tag me daily Day 5 done, day 6 done, day 7 done It's fun, my energy increases more Today I will tell you about strings quickly And today we will know strings a little closer We had read about strings We had seen that strings are a very interesting data type But we will understand what exactly strings are So what happens is that If you close anything in Python in double quote It becomes a string Like if I write here Name is equal to Harry in double quote So this is a string Then I write here Friend is equal to Rohan So this becomes another string If I write here Another friend is equal to Lovish So this becomes another string Now I can make Lovish in single quote So here double quote, here single quote And we can make string in double quote and single quote See I have written here In Python anything that you enclose between single and double quotation marks is considered as string A string is essentially a sequence of array of textual data Strings are used when working with Unicode characters So this is very important And here I have given an example You can copy and paste it and run it If I write name is equal to Harry Which I have already made And after this I run this code So here it is simple Hello Harry I will get to see its output But here you see It does not matter whether you enclose your strings in single or
